abstract: Joe Drape On Horse Racing column remembers life and legacy of late jockey Chris Antley, who will be inducted into  National Museum of Racing's Hall of Fame in Saratoga Springs, NY; says Antley is well known for his success on the track--earning $92,261,894 in purses and capturing 127 graded stakes races, including Kentucky Derby twice--and his own struggles with mental illness and drugs.
lead_paragraph: Chris Antley, who died in 2000 and is being inducted into the National Museum of Racing’s Hall of Fame on Friday, was known for his success on the track and his struggles off it.

headline.print_headline: Troubled Star’s Full Legacy Is on Display
